Kidz Zone

You Can Help The Animals In Your Garden!

Build A Bird Box

*Please Ask An Adult To Help*

Nesting boxes will encourage birds to have baby birds in your garden. Different types of birds like different types of boxes. Put up bird boxes where they are sheltered from the elements and try to put them up before spring so that you do not disrupt the baby bird making season.

Click for Instructions

Soda Bottle Bird Feeder

Empty plastic beverage bottles also make good winter bird feeders. All you need is a bottle, string, a screw eye and something for the perchesâ€”pencils, thin dowels, chopsticks and wooden spoons work well.

More Bird Feeder Ideas

Plant A Tree

Materials needed:

  • One tree (oak, maple, or any other type of tree or bush)
  • Bucket of water
  • Shovel
  • Measuring tape
  • Journal
  • Pen or pencil
  • Camera (optional)

Click for Instructions

A Butterfly Garden

Materials needed:

  • in-ground garden space, raised bed or container garden
  • trowel or shovel
  • flowering plants for adult butterfly
  • host plans for caterpillars

Adopt Me

Jacko The Orangutan

Jacko loves snacking on celery. orangutans are the largest arboreal mammal, spending most of their time in trees.

Adopt Me

Gianno & Georgia

Thirteen-year-old Gianno & twelve-year-old Georgia are brother and sister who love play time.

Adopt Me

Isabel

A beautiful Macaw Parrot.

Fact: Macaws are the biggest of the Parrot species and can live for up to 80 years.

Adopt Me

Surgei

Meerkat (Slender- tailed)

Fact: They forage in groups, taking turns to stand on their hind legs to watch for predators.

Adopt Me

Lucille

Is a caribbean flamingo. Caribbean flamingos are tall, large bodied birds with long necks and small heads.

Adopt Me

Sonego

The Komodo Dragon, the King of the lizards. They are so rare that they are only found on five Indonesian islands. Nickname: land crocodiles.
